div.p: This section describes how you can create a Finished Product from the Formula
To generate the Finished product, you must do the following:

a.css:oxy-alt-text: This section describes how to populate the formula panels
a.title: This section describes how to populate the formula panels

li.a: Step 1 - Populate the Formula Panels (on page )
Step 3 - Create the Finished Product (on page )

div.p: This section describes how to populate the formula panels
div.section: To populate panels, do the following:

li.span: Open the search panel and define Formula from the drop-down list:

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.section:
Create two specifications in the Specifications panel
To create Specifications, do the following:

li.span: Go to the Formula and open the Specifications panel
In the New Specification dialog, select the Formula Specification
Click the New Specification button and select Label Specification from the drop-down list.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.div:
To create the Finished product, first you need:
Populate the Formula panels (on page )
Create Specifications (on page )

section.p: To create the Finished product, do the following:

li.span: Click the Actions button > select Create Finished Product from the drop-down list.
In the Create Finished Product dialog:

ul.li: Fill in the name of the product

div.section: The system creates the Finished product and opens its Navigator in the new tab.
